article.headline: Stetson 73, Mercer 72
article.story: MACON, Ga. (AP) -- E.J. Gordon made a driving layup with 1:27 to play and Stetson held on for a 73-72 victory over Mercer Friday night. Stetson (7-17 overall, 6-9 Atlantic Sun Conference) led 46-35 at halftime, getting its biggest margin just before the buzzer on Anthony Register's 3-pointer. Mercer (6-16, 5-11) rallied behind Andrew Brown's shooting and tied the score at 52, and the lead changed hands several times after that. Gordon's layup gave Stetson a 73-69 lead. Brown's 3-pointer cut the margin to 73-72 with 49 second left. Stetson's Chris Thomas was fouled but missed two free throws with six seconds left, giving Mercer a final chance, but Brown lost the ball near midcourt and the clock ran out as both teams scrambled for possession. Gabe McMillen scored 17 points to lead the Hatters before fouling out in the closing minutes. Gordon added 14. Brown led Mercer with 26 points. Stetson has won five of its last six games.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
